Apprenticeship level: 5
Approximate scheme length: 2 years
Location: London
Salary : Starts from Â£18,624
Eligibility criteria:
5 GCSE's A*-C including maths & English language + 2 A Levels at grade A*-D or equivalent. You are not eligible for this scheme if you currently hold or are working towards a qualification at the same or higher level in a related subject and content from the qualification of this scheme. You must be 18 years of age by 1st September of the year in which you apply, to be eligible for this scheme.

You'll begin a comprehensive development programme designed to kick start your successful career in HR.  A combination of practical, on the job experience and theory will combine to give you an overview of best professional practise, resourcing and talent planning, performance management and employment law.

In your first year on the scheme you will complete 3 four-month placements in the following areas;
HR Services - Customer Delivery: first line response dealing with business queries, gaining an in depth knowledge of our policies and how things work at TfL.
HR Specialist and HR Services: this could include working on talent programmes, specialist recruitment and strategic resourcing projects, or equality and inclusion.
HR Delivery - PMA support: applying practical employment law knowledge to support our business to manage cases including discipline, grievance, and performance.

In the second year, you will complete one placement supporting an HR business partner with a range of initiatives including talent and resourcing, change programmes and organisational structure and design.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"What training and support will I get?"}

For the duration of the scheme you'll have a business sponsor who is responsible for the design and delivery of your training. They will help to secure the right placements for you and support you in your professional development. You'll also have a mentor that'll support and guide you, sharing their knowledge and expertise. Finally, you will have a buddy, who is either a previous apprentice or graduate from your scheme. Your buddy can answer any day to day questions you have and share their experiences with you.

During the scheme you'll not only complete the qualification but also have opportunities to complete additional training courses. These will vary from soft skills training to technical skills training. Your sponsors and placement managers will ensure you attend all the relevant training to support you in your role.

As HR is all about our people, you'll be a strong communicator, able to build relationships easily and collaborate well with others. Beyond that, our HR team is passionate about acting as a forward thinking partner to the business, creating innovative solutions to inform TfL's wider business strategy, and helping to ensure the future of the business. So demonstrating your potential and motivation to learn how to do this is really important.

You'll gain a CIPD Level 5 in Applied Human Resources and become a CIPD associate member. Through a combination of on-the-job learning and classroom training, you'll develop the diverse skills and understanding needed for a successful career in HR. This foundation can lead to a role in employee case management, recruitment, learning and development, talent, equality and inclusion, or business partnering depending on which areas you have developed interests in on the scheme.
